If she has 300 US dollars in the bank but wants to withdraw half of it in British pounds and half of it in euros, how many more euros than pounds will she have? Assume 1 pound = 1.64 USD and 1 euro = 1.32 USD, and round to the nearest whole number.

0.user_question: Kathy needs money for her trip to Europe. If she has 300 US dollars in the bank but wants to withdraw half of it in British pounds and half of it in euros, how many more euros than pounds will she have? Assume 1 pound = 1.64 USD and 1 euro = 1.32 USD, and round to the nearest whole number.

direct_answer.text: Let's first convert Kathy's amount into each currency separately. She would get \$150 x £\(\frac{1}{1.64}\) when converting half of her savings ($150 out of $300) into GBP; so \(£\approx 89\). Similarly, \(\$150 \times \frac{1}{1.32} \) converts into €\(\approx 114\) EUR. Finally comparing them – Kate gets approximately 114 - 89= 25 more Euros than Pounds (\(\pm 1\) due to decimal places rounded up/down.) Thus, The answer is: 25 .
